requirements.text: Implement an admin authentication gate using Internet Identity: only a logged-in admin (authenticated via Internet Identity) may see or use any Add, Edit, or Delete buttons/dialogs across all sections (MissionPage, LatestProgress, EcosystemSpotlight, CybercrimeAwareness, InvestingWisdom, TrustedResources, XPosts, HomePageLinks). Unauthenticated visitors see the content in read-only mode with no mutation controls exposed.

quotes: only change it to read only for viewers on the live version. I don't want just anyone changing anything or writing articles

acceptanceCriteria: When a user is not logged in via Internet Identity, no Add, Edit, or Delete buttons are visible in any section.
When a user is logged in via Internet Identity, all Add, Edit, and Delete controls appear and function as before.
A login button (e.g., 'Admin Login') is visible to unauthenticated users so an admin can authenticate.
A logout button is visible to authenticated users.
Content (articles, spotlights, resources, wisdom quotes, X posts, homepage links, mission) remains fully visible to all visitors regardless of auth state.
No mutations (create, update, delete) are callable from the UI without authentication.

constraints: Do not change any backend data models, CRUD operations, or storage logic.
Do not alter any immutable frontend paths (useInternetIdentity.ts, useActor.ts, main.tsx, components/ui).
All existing visual design, layout, color palette, and tab navigation must remain unchanged.
The existing useInternetIdentity hook must be used as-is for auth state.
nonGoals: Role-based access control beyond a simple authenticated/unauthenticated split.
Backend enforcement of read-only (the restriction is UI-layer only).
Any new content sections or features.
Changes to the data schema or migration logic.
